Reviews.Title: “Great Cruise Port Stay”
Reviews.Author: kenslater10
Reviews.Content: We stayed here before our cruise out of San Pedro. The property is older but being renovated. The staff were outstanding. Very friendly, helpful with directions and suggestions. They offer a free shuttle to the ship, which is only a 5 minute drive away.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, Comfortable and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: SaraW202
Reviews.Content: The San Pedro Inn and Suites is charming and reasonable and conveniently located. The rooms have been fully renovated and the linens new and fresh. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The breakfast area is charming and has plenty of seating area. Free parking is underneath the hotel. We highly recommended it and stayed an extra night. Sara

Reviews.Title: “Good value, like a European Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Julia32174
Reviews.Content: Location is right off the freeway, but once you get inside, you won't believe how nice it looks, antiques, large rooms, and a decent breakfast (buffet, waffles, hard boiled eggs, sausage patties, and the assortment of buns, toast, juice, coffee, tea, etc). One of the rooms smelled like smokers had been there.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel with great staff and clean safe rooms”
Reviews.Author: Jason W
Reviews.Content: Just spent a week staying at the San Pedro Inn on Gaffey. I dont normally have time for writing reviews but this hotel was a great stay, great value and felt really safe. The beds were crispy and clean, the bathroom were tidy and crispy. Our rooms smelt great and breakfast was big and long. We just spent 5 weeks in the US and stayed at some more expensive but far worse horror hotels in Long Beach and one in New Jersey. We loved the fact you could not hear the noise from the road out front and that the floors we stayed on were only accessible by security card and had no access from the outside world. The pool was not in use due to renovations which was a little disappointing but the beach was close by and this hotel is really handy to everything. I just hope when Best Western takes over the value stays. Location wise we did not know San Pedro but we now love it. 1 highway to LA central and close to everything, close by LA standards anyway. We plan to stay again as long as Best Western does not up the prices to suit the grandeur of the old school classy building. Felt like we were staying in Beverly Hills from inside. Jason and Jen Butter Beats Record Stores.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable, convenient, dated”
Reviews.Author: efusco
Reviews.Content: If you're taking a cruise out of San Pedro's port this is a decent hotel to stay at. They have a free shuttle to the port. You could even walk, but it's a pretty good hike with luggage. The decor is dated, there's peeling paint in the bathrooms, and a bit of a musty smell throughout. The fake classic art give it a bit of a Disney Hollywood Hotel feel. The free breakfast is decent and you can get plenty to eat. Didn't check out the pool/spa or exercise room. We had 2 rooms on the 3rd floor...the one on the street side of the building was noisy with little sound proofing and lots of street noise all night long. The one on the back side had a view of a cement wall and a parking lot above the level of the window. There is free wifi--only 2 bar signal in our room, but still it was free and helpful. I called the front desk once to connect with our other room--it rang for 2 minutes, then I got hung up on. Other than that, face to face, the service folks were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Travelers2ofus
Reviews.Content: We two stayed at this hotel for a night before a two-week Hawaiian cruise. The staff and manager were just wonderful. The room was well-appointed and very quiet, even though there was some construction going on. (They are renovating this hotel and doing a brilliant job!) We were very pleased and will stay again without hesitation. We also found San Pedro to be very friendly and a lovely little stop-over.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful trip back in time, with modern conveniences!”
Reviews.Author: skeeter762
Reviews.Content: Out of 5 memorable historic hotels, this is one of them. They have done a good job with remodeling, and still keeping the historic flavor. We stayed in their separate "4 plex" - very nice and private. The room was large, bright and clean, and the bathroom upgrades were nicely done - very nice shower. The morning breakfast was well laid out, with a very nice selection of foods - much more than a typical hotel "breakfast". We had no problem with the area; San Pedro is a "working" town. People were friendly and helpful. For a historic hotel and location, the rates were reasonable. We're glad we found it!

Reviews.Title: “Great breakfast bar and and nice vintage decor.”
Reviews.Author: SantanasWind
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at this economy Inn. There were some inconsistencies with the staff and how they treated us. Some were pleasant and accommodated us when there were problems and others were just rude and could care less if we stayed or left! (Evening female front desk) Overall, I can handle that since it was a great price and again the breakfast bar was really nice and included in the price. Nice big rooms. The pool area looks nicer than pictures on line.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel I would give it a 3.5 if I could”
Reviews.Author: Diane E
Reviews.Content: I booked through Expedia, and I won't do that again. I probably would have done just as well direct. The room was clean and spacious. The area that you are in is not good. There are a LOT of homeless and fairly disreputable people. The breakfast left a lot to be desired, but I am a foodie.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: jeff l
Reviews.Content: Wow. What a terrible experience with this hotel. The General Manager, Edison, had a terrible attitude when dealing with a very simple cancellation. If the general manager has this type of attitude and personality I can only imagine what his hotel is like. Stay away from this one. I didn't even stay there and after cancelling the reservation 10 days in advance it still cost me $250.00. After being called a liar by Edison I just want this experience to go away.

Reviews.Title: “DISHONEST and Stubborn”
Reviews.Author: cory k
Reviews.Content: Cancelled my reservation 20 days in advance with the front desk and told everything was done. Got an email 3 weeks later saying that I no-showed and they charged me. When I called them to nicely talk about it the general manager Addison was rude, could hardly speak english and would not even think about taking care of it the right way or even compromising. I have never dealt with such a jerk in my life. I am sure the hotel is ok, but would not recommend it because the staff were horrible.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent find for cruisers”
Reviews.Author: alibilly2004
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended by our travel agent as a good place to stay on the night before our cruise out of Los Angeles (San Pedro). She was right: it was about a mile from the cruise terminal. Our room looked like one you would find in a top notch hotel in the 1880s. It was elegant and huge, with windows on two sides, and what looked like antique furniture. The deal we were offered was one night's stay, breakfast, a shuttle to and from the cruise ship terminal and free secure parking for fourteen days, all for just $172. This is an excellent deal, considering that just parking at the terminal would have been $168. This hotel has found a good niche for itself, and we hope that it will continue to prosper from cruisers who choose to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Good base for cruise ship travellers.”
Reviews.Author: Tommy72A
Reviews.Content: I've used this hotel several times for our cruise ship vacation. Stayed night before the cruise and we found it to be very comfortable, clean and located close to the cruise terminal. They do have a shuttle service but it's only a 3 min cab ride. About 20 min bus ride to down town Long Beach. A handful of restaurants near by, including couple of drug stores. As for the bad reviews I read here, I didn't see anything that concerned me. I would recommend this place for anyone looking for a good clean affordable place and not expecting a miracle. This is not a five star hotel and their rates set at par. Btw, not a whole lot to do around the neighborhood unless you are willing to drive or cab. Ps. I think they used to a part of Holiday Inn chain and I would say their rooms were better than the average H.I. room set up.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: yoyo19506
Reviews.Content: checked in at this hotel on November 21,2011. found it to be very clean, nice ambience, great buffet breakfast, helpful staff. Neighborhood seems safe, many fast food places, Free shuttle to cruise terminal.. Room price good value.

Reviews.Title: “Price was right”
Reviews.Author: JAFO399
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just right for the price. The entrance to the lobby is not off of Gaffey, but off of 1st street. The receptionist was helpful, and the room was average. We stayed on the 3rd floor, but we should have stayed on the 4th. I could hear the room directly above us walking all night long, and I am a heavy sleeper. The chandelier shook each time the guests walked back and forth which was unpleasant to hear. The breaksfast was surprisingly good. They had several breakfast foods to choose from, and you cannot beat the location to the wharf. All in all an average place to stay for the price. My 1 night stay was $89.00 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Bizarre Hotel”
Reviews.Author: xxliz
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated in a mainly Spanish speaking area and it was a bit difficult to communicate with my little knowledge of Spanish. Receptionist was as helpful as he could be, allowing me to use his telephone to make local calls, with no charge. Although a later receptionist appeared to be a bit surly. Might have been the language barrier. There was no where to eat within walking distance except, burger, fried chicken type of places and we tried one, which was fine. The room was large and comfortable for one night. The bed was really good. The coffee machine was broken and although reported to maid and reception, it remained broken. No room service. Dining room for breakfast was a strange experience with a little hot food badly cooked and some cereals, juice and toast. We were booked at this hotel for an overnight stay after a cruise to Hawaiian Islands so it was a very short stay and compared so badly with our previous accommodation aboard a Princess cruise ship. For one night it is fine but not for a much longer stay.

HotelInfo.Name: San Pedro Inn and Suites Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 111 South Gaffey Street, San Pedro, Los Angeles, CA 90731
